title: Ryze rework
body: Ryze was my only mastery 7 and my most played champ before this terrible rework. Ive played him a few times since and he is just horrible. I dont know how Riot could take such a fun, fast paced champion and turn him into a boring dull mess. His winrate has either been last or second last in top/mid and I don't see riot addressing this at all. No one plays him, he isnt touched in competitive anymore. It was failed rework and should be reverted.

I'm sorry he's not your cup of tea anymore. He was too fast-paced for me before this latest rework and is still too fast-paced.  He is a very hard champion to master.

He definitely was played in the EU competitively, I saw Faker playing him earlier today on stream I think, and I suspect we'll see him in Worlds. Think there's still some probably tricks with him we don't know yet.

Why did you take away Ryze and rework him into a competitive-only champion? You can't deny that his ult has a way more power in coordinated teams. You've essentially Rek'Sai'd him. He will never ever get a fair shot of being balanced for us because of his hidden power in coordinated groups. 

So what we get is a garbage watered down version of him because if he is ever even remotely viable in SoloQ, he will be 100% pick/ban in LCS again. You've done this to {{champion:429}} {{champion:268}}  {{champion:421}} {{champion:8}} already and it needs to stop

I recommend you experiment some more on the new Ryze. He's still a strong champion but he's even harder to play than he used to be.

I don't understand why you say he doesn't machine gun.

The old Ryze combo for max damage was Q E Q W Q E Q. The new Ryze combo for max damage is Q E Q W Q E Q. Nothing actually changed there (but note that to do that fluidly you need to approach 40% cdr).

Honestly, I do really miss Ryze's old ultimate. I can't really make the new one work, I feel it's clunky and unintuitive. Furthermore, it doesn't reset Q as old ultimate did. Nevertheless, if you choose to not put points in your R until 17 and 18, Ryze is still pretty good.

I'm actually so sad. I HAVE been trying new Ryze and he isn't strong... He isn't fun. You can't gap close and your range is the same. Without the old ult someone has to run into your short range before you can do your work. I absolutely loved Ryze and I can't enjoy this new one.

New one is a lot healthier than the old one, but I do want to admit that the new one now requires a lot more mechanical skills than the old one.

Imo, the old was kinda toxic in gameplay. Here's a comparison to their strengths:

http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/4.4.3/img/champion/Ryze.png :

- Spam spells til you reached 3 or 4 stacks.
- Faceroll the keyboard for those AoE damages along with your permasnare combos.
- Shield, bonus movement speed, wave clearing & tons of damage all at once are unhealthy.

https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-aW4O2gTosUw/V3WLQl1Vy8I/AAAAAAAA8T4/L_4j4wNJGBYTtIt-5exMyRiiRTnGYi2ZwCLcB/s1600/Ryze_Square_0.png :

- Wave clearing is now situational & requires timing.
- Multiple combos for multiple strength purposes.
- Have to decide whether getting _bonus ms & shield_ or _tons of damage_ is needed in critical situations.
- More team reliant in terms of engaging with his ult.

He is kinda hard to learn at first but he actually ain't that different. The thing is that he is been given more options that before and which combo jr wanna choose for instance W E Q is for less root but more damage while E W Q is for more root but less damage

And he is still combo machine Q E Q W Q E Q < - thats quite alot abilities in short time

He was picked in competitive after last rework

http://www.lolking.net/champions/ryze?chartType=performanceLoyalty&region=na&map=sr&queue=normal#statistics

This is what you should be looking at. He has a decent skill curve, so players who have not reached an effective level of mastery will often abandon him as a champion. Players who continue to master him will often achieve a higher winrate.
